benchmark_details.name: CHiSafetyBench (Chinese Hierarchical Safety Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: CHiSafetyBench is a dedicated safety benchmark for evaluating large language modelsâ€™ capabilities in identifying risky content and refusing to answer risky questions in Chinese contexts. It incorporates a hierarchical Chinese safety taxonomy consisting of 5 risk areas and 31 categories, covering multiple-choice questions and question-answering tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of the safety capabilities of Chinese LLMs.

data.source: Combination of open resources and manual data writing.
data.annotation: Manual writing and aligned with predefined safety taxonomy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model responses to multiple-choice questions and question-answering tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and rejection rates signify better safety capabilities.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness of automatic evaluation was validated against human assessment results.
